thread.title: NFL Week 7 injuries: Texans' Foster injures Achilles
thread.title_full: NFL Week 7 injuries: Texans' Foster injures Achilles

author: USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY
title: NFL Week 7 injuries: Texans' Foster injures Achilles
text:
NFL Week 7 injuries: Texans' Foster injures Achilles USA Today Sports 3 hrs ago by USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY © Mike Ehrmann, Getty Images Mike Ehrmann, Getty Images Houston Texans Pro Bowl running back Arian Foster, in his fourth game back after returning from groin surgery, suffered what appeared to be a significant Achilles' tendon injury Sunday in the fourth quarter of a loss to the Miami Dolphins. Foster was carried off the field and carted to the locker room.
AdChoices NFL Network reported that the injury was a torn Achilles and would end Foster's season.
Foster had 125 yards and two TDs from scrimmage, yet it all came in garbage time after the Dolphins built a 41-0 first-half lead. Texans coach Bill O'Brien seems sure to regret using such a valuable player (on a wet field, too) with so little on the line at that stage of the game.
Here are the other notable injuries from Week 7:
— Detroit Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford suffered a left hand injury and will have X-rays
— Washington Redskins pass rusher Ryan Kerrigan suffered a broken hand.
— Tampa Bay Buccaneers receiver Louis Murphy suffered a knee injury.
— New York Jets center Nick Mangold suffered a broken hand and will have X-rays.
— Cleveland Browns quarterback Josh McCown left the game against the St. Louis Rams with a shoulder injury and did not return.
— Indianapolis Colts wide receiver Phillip Dorsett was ruled out against the New Orleans Saints with an ankle injury.
— Tennessee Titans cornerback Jason McCourty suffered a hamstring injury against the Atlanta Falcons.
